definition.name: deploy-lock
definition.description: Lock Action to support deployment locking for the branch-deploy Action
definition.author: Grant Birkinbine

inputs.name: github_token
inputs.description: The GitHub token used to create an authenticated client - Provided for you by default!

inputs.name: environment
inputs.description: The explict environment to apply locking actions to when running in headless mode - OR the default environment to use when running in the context of IssueOps commands in a comment - Examples: production, development, etc - Use "global" for the global lock environment

inputs.name: environment_targets
inputs.description: Optional (or additional) target environments to select for use with lock/unlock. Example, "production,development,staging". Example  usage: `.lock development`, `.lock production`, `.unlock staging`

inputs.name: lock_trigger
inputs.description: The string to look for in comments as an IssueOps lock trigger. Used for locking branch deployments on a specific branch. Example: "lock"

inputs.name: unlock_trigger
inputs.description: The string to look for in comments as an IssueOps unlock trigger. Used for unlocking branch deployments. Example: "unlock"

inputs.name: reaction
inputs.description: If set, the specified emoji "reaction" is put on the comment to indicate that the trigger was detected. For example, "rocket" or "eyes"

inputs.name: lock_info_alias
inputs.description: An alias or shortcut to get details about the current lock (if it exists) Example: ".info"

inputs.name: global_lock_flag
inputs.description: The flag to pass into the lock command to lock all environments. Example: "--global"

inputs.name: prefix_only
inputs.description: If "false", the trigger can match anywhere in the comment

inputs.name: mode
inputs.description: The mode to use "lock", "unlock", or "check". If not provided, the default mode assumes the workflow is not headless and triggered by a comment on a pull request - Example: .lock / .unlock

inputs.name: reason
inputs.description: Reason for claiming the deployment lock for this repository

outputs.name: triggered
outputs.description: The string "true" if the trigger was found, otherwise the string "false"

outputs.name: comment_id
outputs.description: The comment id which triggered this deployment (if it was not headless)

outputs.name: type
outputs.description: The type of trigger which was found - 'lock', 'unlock', or 'info-info-alias'

outputs.name: comment_body
outputs.description: The comment body which triggered this action (if it was not headless)

outputs.name: headless
outputs.description: The string "true" if the run was headless, otherwise the string "false" - Headless in this context would be if the "mode" was set and the Action was not invoked by a comment on a pull request

outputs.name: locked
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be "true" if a lock exists, otherwise "false"

outputs.name: lock_environment
outputs.description: When running in headless mode and the "mode" is set to "check", this output will be the environment name that holds the lock, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: branch
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be the branch name that holds the lock, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: created_by
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be the user that holds the lock, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: created_at
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be the ISO 8601 format date that the lock was claimed, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: reason
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be the reason the deployment lock was claimed, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: link
outputs.description: If the mode is set to "check", this output will be the link to the GitHub issue comment or action run that claimed the lock, otherwise it will be empty

outputs.name: global_lock_claimed
outputs.description: The string "true" if the global lock was claimed

outputs.name: global_lock_released
outputs.description: The string "true" if the global lock was released
